name: places/ChIJBVEJ6r1ZwokRFAiE3xAHoLo
adrFormatAddress: 66 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: First time here & it was lovely! They took me as a walk in appointment; great prices, clean facility and great service. This is a gel manicure I got pictured here 10 days AFTER the fact. I weeded my garden, did dishes, showered, and laundry and they’re still in perfect shape.

originalText.text: thanks to  Anna she was amazingly nice she did my nails on Jan 4th they still look great I like this place so far they have been great to me and I went on my break and she did my nails with enough time to get back to work on time

originalText.text: Very clean and well maintained. They need more colors to choose from, and polishes that actually last. One day and my nails did not last at all.

text.text: Very clean and well maintained. They need more colors to choose from, and polishes that actually last. One day and my nails did not last at all.

originalText.text: Pre-COVID I was here every month. I’d never been a manicure person- I work in fitness & outdoors, paying for my nails to be done always resulted in chips & peeling within an hour of having them done & felt like a waste. Even after being introduced to gel, I wasn’t totally sure. I gave it a shot at Blossom Garden before a wedding and was SOLD. Michelle was so careful, meticulously wrapping every edge of my nails in color that ended up lasting nearly 5 weeks. The entire staff is great- Anna jumped in to help with special gel artwork before another event. The gentleman who seems to manage/own the place is always friendly. The massages are such a treat there, too! COVID-specifically, I went back for the first time a few weeks ago, having hesitated when I saw the setup of plastic curtains separating each customer from each other and from their manicurist. It DOES feel a little strange and slightly claustrophobic, but the staff was smiling under their masks & still trying to engage in chat like the “old days” through the plastic sheets. Admittedly a weird experience these days, but I really hope this place survives, they’re so great!

COVID-specifically, I went back for the first time a few weeks ago, having hesitated when I saw the setup of plastic curtains separating each customer from each other and from their manicurist. Admittedly a weird experience these days, but I really hope this place survives, they’re so great!

originalText.text: I’ve been here like 3 times. Today I went in for gel x removal and the nail tech (Alice) filed my nails down so thin. Using gel x is supposed to make the removal process slightly less damaging for your nails but now my nails are the thinnest they have ever been after the removal. I even told her it was burning me when she kept going In with the nail drill. Even after her horrendous job of removing my nails I decided to tip her (which she did not even deserve) and she had the audacity to make a remark about the tip to her co workers. Will never ever go back ever again. And I suggest you don’t either.
